org.restcomm.app.qoslib.Utils

Class QosAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.restcomm.app.qoslib.Utils.QosAPI

  • public class QosAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    QosAPI is the main interface between the client application and the Quality of Service Library These methods allow the app to easily communicate and start and stop the background service using static methods. The main tasks to be performed using this class are:
    • start the service
    • set the login, and in some cases a password. This will register with the server.
    • Request QoS information such as all the mobile network measurements
    • Trigger events such as speed tests, which gather data and send to the server
    • Check for permissions

    Since:
    1.0

      static void checkHostApp(android.content.Context context) 
      static java.lang.String getLogin(android.content.Context context)
      Get the login name that was set with setLogin The login name can be an email or any type of name, but it should be unique to avoid mixing data with another user
      static java.lang.String getPassword(android.content.Context context)
      Get the password name that may have been set with setLogin The password is optional but is used to login to the website to view data If an email is used as a login name, there is no need to set a password because it can be set via email There is also no need to set a password if the user does not need to directly access data on the web site
      static java.lang.CharSequence getQosInfo(android.app.Activity activity) 
      static QosInfo getQoSInfo(android.content.Context context)
      Request a snapshot of all of the Network data the service has obtained Network, Cell, Signal and Location data The first call to this may not have up-to-date signal data, but it will begin listening so that subsequent calls will be up-to-date The information will already be up to date during or just after a phone call, active test, or coverage sampling For best results, call repeatedly on an interval
      static boolean isEventEnabled(android.content.Context context, org.restcomm.app.utillib.DataObjects.EventType eventType)

      Set the login name to register the user with The user/login is used to group data on the server collected by this device It will register with the server if the service has been started

      Set the login name to register the user with This version also sets a password for the user The user/login is used to group data on the server collected by this device

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static void start(android.content.Context context,
                         boolean bFromUI)
        Start the MMC/QOS Service. Keep this running to monitor for phone calls and other events This should be called as soon as possible, before other calls to the library If a login has been set with setLogin, it will register in the background if needed
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context

      • getLogin

        public static java.lang.String getLogin(android.content.Context context)
        Get the login name that was set with setLogin The login name can be an email or any type of name, but it should be unique to avoid mixing data with another user
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context
        Returns:
        the login name that has been set for the user

      • getPassword

        public static java.lang.String getPassword(android.content.Context context)
        Get the password name that may have been set with setLogin The password is optional but is used to login to the website to view data If an email is used as a login name, there is no need to set a password because it can be set via email There is also no need to set a password if the user does not need to directly access data on the web site
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context
        Returns:
        the password that has been set for the user

      • setLogin

        public static void setLogin(android.content.Context context,
                            java.lang.String login)
        Set the login name to register the user with The user/login is used to group data on the server collected by this device It will register with the server if the service has been started
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context
        login - login name can be an email or any type of name, but it should be unique to avoid mixing data with another user

      • setLogin

        public static void setLogin(android.content.Context context,
                            java.lang.String login,
                            java.lang.String password)
        Set the login name to register the user with This version also sets a password for the user The user/login is used to group data on the server collected by this device
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context
        login - login name can be an email or any type of name, but it should be unique to avoid mixing data with another user
        password - optional but is used to login to the website to view data

      • setLoginToIMEI

        public static void setLoginToIMEI(android.content.Context context)
        Set the login name anonymously to be the device IMEI The user/login is used to group data on the server collected by this device
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context

      • startEvent

        public static int startEvent(android.content.Context context,
                             org.restcomm.app.qoslib.UtilsOld.ActiveEvent event)
        Trigger an Active Event manually from the application, generally this is a type of active test or coverage gathering Allowable events are from ActiveEvent
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context
        {@link - ActiveEvent} type of event to start
        Returns:
        0 if successful, 1 if event type can't be triggered, 2 if event is not enabled for your user, 3 if app doesnt have necessary permissions

      • startDriveTest

        public static int startDriveTest(android.content.Context context,
                                 int minutes,
                                 boolean coverage,
                                 int speed,
                                 int connectivity,
                                 int sms,
                                 int video,
                                 int audio,
                                 int web,
                                 int vq,
                                 int youtube,
                                 int ping)
        Trigger an extended 'drive test' combining different types of tests on intervals
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context
        minutes - duration to repeat the tests in minutes
        coverage - true to gather coverage during the duration of the test
        speed - run speed tests during the test, the value is the number of minutes in betwee
        connectivity - run connectivity tests during the test, the value is the number of minutes in between
        sms - run sms tests during the test, the value is the number of minutes in between
        video - run video streaming tests during the test, the value is the number of minutes in between
        audio - run audio streaming tests during the test, the value is the number of minutes in between
        web - run web page load tests during the test, the value is the number of minutes in between
        vq - run voice quality tests during the test, the value is the number of minutes in between
        youtube - run youtube streaming tests during the test, the value is the number of minutes in between
        youtube - run ping tests during the test, the value is the number of minutes in betwee
        Returns:
        0 if successful

      • isEventEnabled

        public static boolean isEventEnabled(android.content.Context context,
                                     org.restcomm.app.utillib.DataObjects.EventType eventType)
        Check whether an Active test EventType is able to run
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context
        eventType - EventType type of event to check
        Returns:
        true if EventType is enabled to run

      • isEventPermitted

        public static boolean isEventPermitted(android.content.Context context,
                                       org.restcomm.app.utillib.DataObjects.EventType eventType,
                                       int trigger)
        Check whether an Active test EventType has Android permissions needed to run
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context
        eventType - EventType type of event to check
        trigger - 0 to trigger the event manually, 1 to see if it can trigger the event automatically
        Returns:
        true if EventType is enabled to run

      • getQoSInfo

        public static QosInfo getQoSInfo(android.content.Context context)
        Request a snapshot of all of the Network data the service has obtained Network, Cell, Signal and Location data The first call to this may not have up-to-date signal data, but it will begin listening so that subsequent calls will be up-to-date The information will already be up to date during or just after a phone call, active test, or coverage sampling For best results, call repeatedly on an interval
        Parameters:
        context - pass your context
        Returns:
        QosInfo where The most relevant information is contained in the connectedNetwork QosInfo.NetworkInfo
